thread.title: Beeline VMS Gains Market Share According to Staffing Industry Analysts Report
thread.title_full: Beeline VMS Gains Market Share According to Staffing Industry Analysts Report

title: Beeline VMS Gains Market Share According to Staffing Industry Analysts Report
text:
August 19, 2015 10:07 ET Beeline VMS Gains Market Share According to Staffing Industry Analysts Report 
Defying Industry Trend Toward Slowing Growth, Beeline Surges 39% 
JACKSONVILLE, FL --(Marketwired - August 19, 2015) - Beeline, a global leader in software solutions for managing the extended workforce, announced today that a recent industry report showed the company's flagship product, Beeline Vendor Management System (VMS), made dramatic gains in market share in the last 12 months. The results were published by Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA) in their "2015 VMS & MSP Competitive Landscape," an annual survey that tracks the evolution of contingent workforce management and identifies suppliers' strengths and weaknesses relative to their peers to help VMS program owners and stakeholders evaluate providers. 
SIA reported that Beeline's spend under management has grown 39% since the previous survey in 2014. While SIA's VMS survey respondents reported an average growth rate of 22%, SIA estimated the VMS market's actual overall growth rate in 2015 at between 10 and 15%, reasoning that the US market's maturing has led to a number of former participants no longer responding to their survey. 
Based on data from current and previous years, SIA estimated that Beeline currently leads all VMS providers in spend under management outside the US and has moved into second place, from third in 2014, in US market share. 
"We are pleased that SIA has noted our remarkable growth in the US and global market," said Ron Litton, Beeline's senior vice president of sales. "But growth isn't so much a result of our accomplishments as it is organizations recognizing what they can accomplish using our solutions. Our success is really just the result of achieving successful outcomes for a growing number of clients." 
About SIA Staffing Industry Analysts is the global advisor on contingent work. The company provides accreditation with its Certified Contingent Workforce Professional (CCWP) program. Founded in 1989 and acquired by Crain Communications Inc. in 2008, the company is headquartered in Mountain View, California, with offices in London, England. For more information: www.staffingindustry.com 
About Beeline Beeline is a market leader in software solutions for sourcing and managing the extended workforce. Offering intelligent workforce solutions, Beeline helps procurement, sourcing, and human resources professionals optimize costs, reduce risks, and add value to their contingent labor programs. Award-winning business intelligence, superior technology, a global network of local knowledge, and service-driven colleagues dedicated to client success make Beeline an essential business partner for today's leading enterprises. Beeline is a strategic and independently operated business unit of Adecco Group, the world's leading provider of HR solutions. To learn more, visit beeline.com. Contact Information 
For press inquiries only, please contact: Jessica Ashcraft
